document_data.name: Eternal Order of Kelemvor
document_data.mainbody: The '''Eternal Order of Kelemvor''' were followers of [[Kelemvor]] who maintained the [[Neverdeath Graveyard]] in [[Neverwinter]].
document_data.Activities: Their duty was to maintain the sanctity of Neverdeath, a graveyard that was considered sacred to Kelemvor. In keeping with the tenants of the [[church of Kelemvor]], they taught that death was natural and not to be feared but that [[undead]] were unnatural and had to be destroyed. They saw themselves as servants of both the dead and the bereaved: they conducted funerals, ensured that the dead could rest in peace, provided counseling to those who lost loved ones, and destroyed undead.
document_data.Relationships: The Order was aligned with Neverwinter, including the [[New Neverwinter]] movement and the [[Neverwinter Guard]].
document_data.History: When the undead began to rise in the late 15{{th}} century [[DR]], the Eternal Order of Kelemvor's duty shifted to fighting the undead and the [[Thay]]an [[necromancer]]s raising them. By {{Yearlink|1479}}, they had lost control of the graveyard and had retreated to a small camp known as [[Doomguide's Watch]].
document_data.Members:
The Eternal Order comprised [[Doomguide]]s and their [[acolyte]]s. As of 1479 DR, notable members included:
* Doomguide [[Volahk]], the leader of the Eternal Order
* Doomguide [[Awen]]
* Doomguide [[Falstaff]]
* Doomguide [[Ganilon]]
* Doomguide [[Orran]]
* Doomguide [[Severin]]
* Doomguide [[Stonehammer]]
* Doomguide [[Winlof]]
* Acolyte [[Mina Neyman]]
